noChoice.Text: You wake up in a panic. 'Where am I?' You look around. What should you do?

getUp.Text: You stand up and walk to the door, exiting the room. You go to the main desk, a woman greeting you.
Desk worker: Miss Rine? You're awake!

whatYear.Text: Desk worker: You’ve been asleep for quite some time. It’s 2014. Just turned fall a few days ago.
Desk worker: Some time in 2008, I believe. You’ve been one of our few chronic patients.

whyAmIHere.Text: Desk worker: Dear, you’ve been in a coma for six years. I’m surprised you can even walk in your state.
'Well, it’s not as easy as it looks…'

canILeave.Text: Desk worker: Without authorization from a legal guardian, we can’t release you from the hospital. Let me see…
The woman types into the computer, looking up her files.
Desk worker: It seems both your guardians are deceased,
and the orphanage you were placed under has been shut down for over three years now for misconduct.
Desk worker: If you fill out this paperwork, you can be released momentarily.
You fill out the paperwork and hand it to the woman.
Desk worker: After we check your vitals, you are good to go.
The screen goes black, then comes back with M at the door.
Desk worker: Hope you feel better, Miss Rine.
You walk out the door. SCENE END.

remainInBed.Text: You stay in bed. After a while, a nurse comes into the room. Nurse: You’re awake! How are you feeling?

iFeelCrap.Text: Nurse: Oh, let me get you some pain killers. I’ll be just a minute.

iFeelFine.Text: Nurse: That’s good… But don’t sit up too fast, you might feel faint.
The nurse comes over, helping you adjust.

food.Text: Nurse: Right now, you won’t be able to handle solid food, but we can get you something to eat.
The nurse walks over to the door and presses a button, speaking into the device above.
She sits down in the chair next to the bed to wait. After a minute or so another nurse comes
into the room with a tray and places it on the bed before leaving. There is a cup with a straw
poking out of it. You try a bit of the food.

water.Text: Nurse: Alright, I’ll get you some.
She goes to the sink in the room and fills up a cup, giving it to M. M drinks a bit of it and sets it on the table next to the bed.

wantToLeave.Text: Nurse: Miss Rine, you need to rest! You aren’t in a healthy state right now.
You try to sit up, the nurse protesting.
Nurse: I suggest you stay in your bed.
You look at her, confused but persistent. You try to get up again, but are pushed down by the nurse.
Nurse: Go back to sleep, little girl.
You gasp, a shock going through your body at the nurse's touch. You fall unconscious.

stayInBed.Text: You remain in bed, waiting. The nurse returns in a minute or so with pills and a cup of water.
You take the cup and swallow the pills, gulping down the water. You look at the nurse.
You start feeling sleepy, and lie back down. The nurse's expression twists.

attemptToLeave.Text: <i>You try getting out of bed, groaning in pain as you stand. You make your way to the door and look out, making sure
the hall is clear. You walk into the foyer, avoiding eye contact with the woman at the main desk. You make your way to the exit.
Desk worker: Um, miss, you can't leave without written consent!
You exit anyway, slipping into the shadows.
